intro: Dendropanax proteus, commonly known as the African arrowleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, arrow-shaped leaves that are typically leathery in texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions. Dendropanax proteus prefers well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it suitable for both indoor and outdoor gardens.
